newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil expands Proex export finance list.
newsitem.headline: Brazil expands Proex export finance list.

text.p: The Brazilian government will expand as of Thursday the list of goods eligible for special Proex export financing, said Paulo Jobim, executive secretary of the Industry and Commerce Ministry.
Jobim said that a decree to be published Thursday would expand the list to 463 groups of products from 358 groups.

In addition, the two Proex credit lines -- one for pure financing and the other used to subsidise interest rate differentials between Brazil and abroad -- will be merged and minimum repayment terms cut to 12 months from 18 months.
"The Proex lines have been underused. Many firms don't know how to get access. We want to increase the number of takers, especially among small firms," Jobim told reporters.
The $300 million in credit for financing and $700 million for so-called interest rate "equalization" will now be available to all product groups that qualify.
Previously, financing and equilization were restricted to capital goods and durable consumer goods.
According to Helio Mauro Franca, director of the foreign trade policy department, everything but main export commodities such as soybean, cocoa and iron ore will now be covered.
Mauro and Jobim said the aim in particular was to target small firms manufacturing such products as shoes and fresh fruit.
The $1.0 billion is already budgeted. Proex funds are administered by federal Banco do Brasil.
